result.execSummary:
The defendant Kari L Bryant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

PLEA:
Ct 1 (Child Abuse-Repeater)>>GUILTY
Ct 2 (DC-Repeater)>>GUILTY
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS:

14CF482:

Ct 1 (Child Abuse-Repeater)>>SWH.  Probation for 3 years.
Ct 2 (DC-Repeater)>>SWH.  Probation for 2 years.
CONDITIONS:  Counseling deemed appropriate by agent, psychological evaluation and any follow up, take medication as prescribed by doctor, no contact with vics unless approved by the agent, DNA sample w/surcharge, any outstanding financial obligations reduced to a civil judgment.

Ct 1 (Battery)>>6 months MCJ w/Huber for treatment if otherwise eligible, concurrent to each other and to any other, credit for 131 days.

Case Called: 10:03 am 
State appears by ADA Amanda Jadin; Deft appears in person, in custody, pro se. 
Date and Time was set for Preliminary hearing. 
State notes def does NOT have an attorney at this time but is requesting indigency hearing as she does not believe she qualifies for public defender appointment. 
COURT instructs def to apply for public defender before indigency hearing. 
COURT questions def regarding preliminary hearing - COURT notes time limits for prelim can still be met if hearing set on next Monday. 
COURT resets preliminary hearing to 6/30/2014 at 9am in Br. 4. 
COURT sets Indigency hearing on 6/26/2014 at 10:30 am in Br. 2. 
State provides def with a copy of criminal complaint to give to public defender.
